Title: American Relief Agency - Report on American relief work. 8
Notes: (Right image) The Relief Agency has helped and supported an orphanage where the youngsters are trained to produce light industrial products like shoes, blankets, belts and other textiles. It is expected that before long, this institution will be able function independently on the level that it did before the war. (Left image) The Relief Agencies other projects include caring for poor destitute children, helping and supporting orphanages and old-people's homes, and, by engaging in social support work, raising the levels of the people's lives and work.Nr. 8 of the poster set on the Economic Aid Agreement between the United States of America and the Republic of China (3 July 1948).
